messages.title: More Council Tax rises on the way

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plans have been laid before Bolton Council for a feasibility study into a new Westhoughton Bypass. This is something residents have been requesting for many years to relieve the heavy traffic choking up the old road. The proposal study has been carried and some plans to share with the public will be available after a public meeting to discuss their master plan.

A part of the budget process £2.5 million was allocated to the refurbishment of the Town Hall, of course welcome and investment in Westhoughton. We did however put forward an amendment to the Labour budget suggesting that investment in the Town Hall be capped at £1 million with the balance of £1.5 million invested in infrastructure projects throughout the rest of the borough.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: MORE COUNCIL TAX RISES ON THE WAY
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Labour Party in Bolton passed a budget in February to increase Council Tax by 4.8%. They had the option of inflation, since 1990 taking costs £450. A decade of Labour from 2004 to 2014 costs you £300 on your council tax bill. Added to rising costs, £950 tax increase from Labour compared to £340 from Conservatives. Labour always ask you to pay more in Government grants cut towards more inefficiency in the previous administration left a black whole in every year accounts.

images.caption: Cllr. Martyn Cox with Chris Green MP on the Chorley/Leigh border

leaflet.additionalNotes: News from Westhoughton North and Chew Moor Conservatives. Caring and Campaigning for our Community.
